questions.question: What is the main conflict in the "The Lady or the Tiger?"

choices.answer: Person vs. Person
Person vs. Self
Person vs. Nature
Person vs. Society

questions.question: Which word best describes the king?

choices.answer: Civil
Joyful
Miserable
Semi-Barbaric

questions.question: Which word best describes the princess?

choices.answer: Mean
Semi-Barbaric
Conflicted
Ignorant

questions.question: Which statement best describes the main idea of the story?

choices.answer: The princess must decide the fate of a young man.
Every country has its own justice system.
The king is a brilliant and reasonable ruler.
The princess is jealous of the lady behind the door.

questions.question: The young man was on trial because . . .

choices.answer: He stole something from the court.
He questioned the king's character.
He fell in love with the princess.
The princess saw him speaking to the beautiful young lady.

questions.question: Which of these events happens last in the story?

choices.answer: The princess sees her lover talking to the beautiful lady.
The king throws the young man into prison.
The king discovers the young man loves the princess.
The princess signals the young man to open the right door.

questions.question: The king will be rid of the young man because . .

choices.answer: The princess no longer loves the young man.
The young man will either be killed or marry the other lady.
The princess will help the young man escape from prison.
The young man will marry the princess.

questions.question: What does the young man assume about the princess?

choices.answer: That she will save his life.
That she has fallen in love with someone else.
That she is proud and arrogant like her father.
That she does not want to be with him anymore.

questions.question: What is the author's purpose in writing this story?

choices.answer: To make a point about rulers and their servants.
To explain how the king administered justice.
To present to readers a question to think about.
To persuade readers that life in ancient times was unfair.

questions.question: The king "believed that he was a brilliant and reasonable sovereign." What does sovereign mean?

choices.answer: A Citizen
A Leader
An Athlete
A Scholar

questions.question: Why does the king disapprove of the young man?

choices.answer: He was already married.
He kidnapped the king's daughter.
He was a violent criminal.
He loved the princess even though he was only a commoner.

questions.question: How did the king punish the criminals in his kingdom?

choices.answer: Through a civilized trial in a courtroom, with a judge.
He executed them in front of the whole kingdom.
He sent them Tupelo, MS, to do community service.
He placed them in an arena and they chose between two doors.

questions.question: What happens if the accused person chooses the door with the lady?

choices.answer: The lady decides whether or not he will live.
The lady takes all of his money.
The two are immediately married.
The man must be the lady's servant.

questions.question: Did the princess's lover follow her directions in the arena?

choices.answer: Yes, without hesitation.
Yes, but he did so reluctantly.
No, he did not trust her.
He did not choose either door.

questions.question: What is the outcome of the story?

choices.answer: He chooses the door with the tiger and is violently killed.
He listens to the princess but the outcome is unknown.
He chooses the door with the lady and marries her.
He chooses the door with the lady but refuses to marry her.
